thread.title: United Airlines offers sneak peek at its newest widebody jet
thread.title_full: United Airlines offers sneak peek at its newest widebody jet

author: Lewis Lazare
title: United Airlines offers sneak peek at its newest widebody jet
text:
United Airlines offers sneak peek at its newest widebody jet Jul 21, 2015, 3:10pm MDT Updated Jul 21, 2015, 3:14pm MDT Share DonMotzJr The Airbus 350 touched down at Chicago's O'Hare International Airport Friday afternoon. United Airlines — the biggest carrier at Denver International Airport — has provided a sneak look at its new widebody Airbus 350 aircraft. Airbus' latest creation, meant to compete with Chicago-based Boeing's 787 Dreamliner, won't enter United's fleet until 2018. But that didn't stop United (NYSE: UAL) from showing off the plane Friday afternoon to invited guests and airline employees in a hangar at Chicago's O'Hare International Airport a full three years early. The A 350-1000 model United will get is a stretch version of the A 350-900 that already is part of the Qatar Airways fleet. American Airlines (Nasdaq: AAL) and Delta Air Lines (NYSE: DAL) are expected be begin taking delivery of 900-series planes in 2017. But United Airlines will be the launch North American carrier for the stretch A 350-1000.
